Articles.Content:
Yes, this is a configuration for RSS that has the stock planets but at 1/10th the stock size. That means Kerbin has a 60 km radius, its atmosphere ends at 7 km up, the Mun orbits at 1140 km, etc. The orbital and rotational periods are also scaled to match, and the surface gravities should be the same as stock.

Still having some problems with the terrain of some planets (Minmus looks pretty cool though). But Kerbin itself should actually be OK. It's pretty fun, like KSP on easy mode.

DOWNLOAD

Installation instructions: Put this file into your KSP/GameData/RealSolarSystem folder, and remove the file "RealSolarSystem.cfg" from that folder.

A time control mod is recommended, since the default altitudes for time warp are way too high now.

Known bugs:

-Kerbin's atmosphere seems to cut off rather abruptly when viewed from the ground.

-lots of exaggerated terrain, mainly on the smaller bodies

-Laythe suddenly has lots of small islands

-Gilly and Bop seem to lag a lot as you get close to them

edit: Renegrade has a RealSolarSystemSettings.cfg file for balanced solar power generation in post #6 below.

Edited October 29, 2014 by metaphor

When you mentioned you were making a 1/10th scale Kerbin, I was reminded of that xkcd thing about the Little Prince's asteroid/planet (http://what-if.xkcd.com/68/), and became very excited, and started to make my own version.

It's less developed, but I do have a powercurve in RealSolarSystemSettings.cfg that might help:

http://alpha.renegrade.net/Kerbin10Percent.zip

There are/were some issues in mine that were amusing, so I made some screenshots:

Really, it's not sillier than stock? It's literally a factor of 10 times sillier than stock.

I've decided on some names for all the planets here.

Kerbol->Kerbolita

Moho->Mohill

Eve->Evie

Gilly->Space Rock

Kerbin->Kirbin

Mun->Smun

Minmus->Minni

Duna->Duni

Dres->Drix

Jool->Jill

Laythe->Lith

Tylo->Tillo

Vall->Vil

Bop->Kraken Rock

Pol->Grain

Eeloo->Ellie
Here's a dumb idea: Use all of the realism hardmode mods (like Interstellar WasteHeat, DangIt, FAR, DR, Isp Difficulty Scaler, etc.) And also 1/10 scale Stock System mod, for mixed effect.
I've been messing around, and using Kerbal Isp Difficulty Scaler, 0.3 is a good number to make the Kerbal X a one-way Smun-lander.

I've been messing around, and using Kerbal Isp Difficulty Scaler, 0.3 is a good number to make the Kerbal X a one-way Smun-lander.

That makes sense since the delta-v's are about 3 times smaller than stock (sqrt(10) to be more precise).

That makes sense since the delta-v's are about 3 times smaller than stock (sqrt(10) to be more precise).

I did not realize this! That's pretty cool actually. I just made a guesstimate. I'm now using 0.6, because I like the ability to use tiny rockets in a tiny system.

So I flew a few missions here.

It's a miniaturized Kerbal X. Why would you want that? Well, the stock system has been rescaled to 10% it's current size. To facilitate this, I use Kerbal Isp Difficulty Scaler to turn down the rocket efficiency. I have Atmosphere and Vacuum set to 0.6, but I might lower that to 0.5 because this rocket is still a bit too overpowered. I also use Time Control to allow proper timewarping altitudes.

Here's 1/10 Scale System config for RSS:

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/95122-1-10-Stock-System-Config-for-RSS

And here's Kerbal Isp Difficulty Scaler:

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/52882-0-25-Kerbal-Isp-Difficulty-Scaler-v1-4-1-10-7-14

Here's the .craft file if you want it.

https://www.dropbox.com/s/fl2jzcuotbqr4pp/Kirbin%20X.craft?dl=0
